subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Tuesday, 05 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Aston Villa bid £7m for Reo-Coker
Aston Villa launch a £7m bid for West Ham captain Nigel Reo-Coker.



 
Barton has medical at Newcastle
Joey Barton undergoes a medical at Newcastle as they - and West Ham - agree £5.5m deals for the Man City star.



 
Viduka set for Newcastle transfer
Newcastle agree in principle to sign Middlesbrough striker Mark Viduka.








GOLF




Tiger prepares to take baby break
Tiger Woods says his schedule for the rest of 2007 is up in the air as he awaits the arrival of his first child.



 
Welsh amateur wins US Open spot
Rhys Davies  books his place in next week's US Open with a brilliant win in a qualifying tournament.



 
Ryder pair fail in US qualifying
Ryder Cup stars Darren Clarke and Paul McGinley will miss the US Open next week after failing to qualify at Walton Heath.








MOTORSPORT




Massa predicts Ferrari fightback
Ferrari will bounce back from a poor Monaco Grand Prix to contest victory in Canada, says driver Felipe Massa.



 
Anstey celebrates Superstock win
New Zealander Bruce Anstey sets a lap record on his way to winning the Superstock race at the Isle of Man TT.



 
McGuinness triumphs in TT opener
Honda rider John McGuinness claims his fourth straight Superbike victory at the Isle of Man TT on Monday.








FORMULA ONE




Massa predicts Ferrari fightback
Ferrari will bounce back from a poor Monaco Grand Prix to contest victory in Canada, says driver Felipe Massa.



 
Valencia secures F1 street race
Valencia signs its contract to  host a Grand Prix around the Spanish city's streets from 2008.



 
McLaren cleared over Hamilton row
McLaren are cleared of any wrongdoing after an investigation into whether they illegally used team orders in the Monaco Grand Prix.








ATHLETICS




Pickering wins battle of Britain
Craig Pickering wins the battle of the Brits as he storms home in the all-British 100m at the Glasgow Grand Prix.



 
Weir leads strong British display
Dave Weir wins four races at the Swiss Open event in Ibach.



 
Gay misses out on sprint record
Tyson Gay wins the 100m in New York but is denied a world record as his run was wind-assisted.








CYCLING




Ex-team boss denies drug claims
Former Telekom team manager Walter Godefroot denies being involved in the doping of riders during the 1990s.



 
Zabel to stay away from Olympics
German cyclist Erik Zabel will not compete in next year's Beijing Olympics after his confession that he used performance-enhancing drugs in 1996.



 
Di Luca seals home Giro victory
Danilo di Luca ensures a home victory in the Giro d'Italia for the 11th year running as he cruises home in Milan.








FUN AND GAMES




Quotes of the Week
Graham Poll on his yellow peril, plus Frankie Dettori and the legendary Sid Waddell



 
Comment: Time to rest Lampard
Robbo believes Frank Lampard should be dropped by England



 
Review of the week
Kieran Richardson's cousin on Big Brother as Ronaldo's mum spits feathers
